page.title: 09FIRE STATION
page.content: The Fire Station was built in 1937. The full time station covers the whole of Kirkcaldy District. At the Fire station they have six engines. There are two spares, one water tender, one water ladder, one decontamination unit and one hydraulic platform. There is about half a mile of hose altogether on a water tender. The water ladder has four ladders ranging from 5 meters to 13.5 meters. The fire engines can hold 400 gallons of water. There are four shifts and 16 men on each shift. On average Kirkcaldy Fire Station has 1,400 fires annually - grass fires in summer, chimney fires in winter with chip pan fires all year round. There is a foam maker for oil fires, special tools and suits for chemical fires. When there are no fires the firemen test their equipment and paint the hydrants.
